text: Pieter de Groot, universally known as "Big Piet", is a bear of a man from Suiddock. As the Guild's Champion, he is skilled in both swordplay and calculus.

Reputedly the richest man in the world. He counts among his personal friends the Tsar of Kislev, the King of Bretonnia, the Sultan of Araby and even Emperor Karl Franz and the Electors. Why? Because they all owe him.

Simon Goudenkruin is the Arch-Priest of the Cult of Haeyndrik, the minor god of wealth, power and influence. For a large fee he will lend any men, elf or dwarf financial advice. No guarantees, however.
The Sword of Solkan is an agent of the Knights of Purity, nobody knows his true identity - but all fear his blessed sword and irrational determiniation to eradicate evil.
The Merchant Lords of Marienburg are as extrovert as they are clever.
A graduate of Baron Henryk's College and an expert at Sea Magicks, considered hedge wizards by some.

The Lore of the Sea is based around the manipulation and transformation of water. It is completely unrelated to the so-called Lore of the Deep, which has been rightfully banned as unholy magic of the evil Stromfel. Although not formally recognized as one of the major lores by Teclis, it is commonly taught at the Baron Henryk's academy in Marienburg.
Camilla Dauphine is both known with Manann's prayers as well as parts of the minor lore of the sea.
Descended from the wild ponies of Kislev, Wastelander warhorses are suited to harsher climates.
Smaller than their powerful Bretonnian equivalents, barding protects Wastelander warhorses from blows that would otherwise fell these proud beasts.
This barded warhorse comes from the stable of the Knights Mariner, it's expertly trained in galloping up and down the harsh beaches of the Old World.
The majestic beast called Voorwind is the Matriarch's personal envoy, it's a sight to behold to see it accelerate between the masts of incoming ships.
The altar prominently features Manann, bearing his trident and five-tined crown.
Captain Aber Walblatt is the mighty Knight Mariner who hunted the Red Chaos Whale for over nine years, not setting foot on land a single time.
A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.
Make sure those saddle straps are tight, boy, this isn't like falling off a normal horse.
